MushroomForest

Class MainScene

  • java.lang.Object
    • GraphicsLab.GraphicsLab
      • MushroomForest.MainScene

  • public class MainScene
extends GraphicsLab

    Mushroom Forest

    This is the Main Scene and entry point for this program
    This is a 3D Scene - an interactive demo showing multiple animations and interactions.

    The user can interact with this scene

    W S A and D will move the camera around the scene
    Arrow Keys will rotate the camera

    The = key will increse the number of mushrooms
    The - key will decrese the number of mushrooms

    Author:
    Jedd Morgan

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void applyCameraTransform()
      Applies the camera translation and rotation to an object

      This method should be called between
      GL11.glPushMatrix and GL11.glPopMatrix method calls during the rendering of every model that should move relative to the camera
      private void checkMushroomLOD()
      This method will check if a quarter of the max number of mushrooms (maxMushroomCount) are being drawn
      If over a quarter are drawn, then this will switch out to a lower level of detail model

      sMushroom should have roughly a quarter of the number of faces as mMushroom, so 4 times as many can be drawn
      protected void checkSceneInput()
      Checks for user input corresponding to the sample scene
      private void generateRenderInstances()
      This method will generate / regenerate RenderInstance in the scene.
      This method is used on first initialisation of the scene
      And when the objects in the scene need to be regenerated e.g.

      • generateRenderInstances

        private void generateRenderInstances()
        This method will generate / regenerate RenderInstance in the scene.
        This method is used on first initialisation of the scene
        And when the objects in the scene need to be regenerated e.g. to change the number of mushrooms

      • checkSceneInput

        protected void checkSceneInput()
        Checks for user input corresponding to the sample scene
        This method will check for user input controlling the camera, and interactions within the scene
        Specified by:
        checkSceneInput in class GraphicsLab

      • checkMushroomLOD

        private void checkMushroomLOD()
        This method will check if a quarter of the max number of mushrooms (maxMushroomCount) are being drawn
        If over a quarter are drawn, then this will switch out to a lower level of detail model

        sMushroom should have roughly a quarter of the number of faces as mMushroom, so 4 times as many can be drawn

      • setSceneCamera

        protected void setSceneCamera()
        Description copied from class: GraphicsLab
        Sets default values for the sample's viewpoint and projection settings. This behaviour may be overriden by each sample to provide customised camera control; alternatively, deriving classes may call super.setSceneCamera and then provide custom camera position and orientation
        Overrides:
        setSceneCamera in class GraphicsLab

      • applyCameraTransform

        private void applyCameraTransform()
        Applies the camera translation and rotation to an object

        This method should be called between
        GL11.glPushMatrix and GL11.glPopMatrix method calls during the rendering of every model that should move relative to the camera
